intro: Quinaria cuspidifera, commonly known as the sharp-pointed quinaria, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves with acute tips and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments, such as forest understories or rocky crevices. Its fruit is a capsule that releases tiny seeds when mature. Quinaria cuspidifera is often found in tropical and subtropical regions of Central and South America.
